laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The continuous right facial twitching was recorded with a focus in the left frontal area during a follow-up EEG, with broad electrical field involving the entire left hemisphere and characterized by spike-and-wave discharges.

laboratory_examinations.date: Between 6 years and 8 years of age
laboratory_examinations.findings: Progressive atrophy in the left cerebral hemisphere. A focal lesion with high signal intensity in the left precentral and postcentral gyral cortex.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive enlargement of the cerebral sulci and contraction of the gyri in the left hemisphere over a period of 2 years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Decrease in the ratio of N-acetylaspartate to creatine with no increase in the ratio of choline to creatine.
Seizure activity in the left frontal lobe with abnormal somatosensory-evoked magnetic fields suggestive of cortical dysfunction.

laboratory_examinations.date: Three months after the initial evaluation
laboratory_examinations.findings: Focus of continuous right facial twitching in the left frontal area, with 6 generalized tonicâ€“clonic seizures noted.
